content_1: In   Heilongjiang Province, China, officials at local monitoring stations have been   told to keep a close watch over migratory birds at wild bird habitats and live   bird markets for signs of animal epidemics as the province borders South Korea,   where recent H5N1 outbreaks have occurred.
content_2: In South Korea, the culling of over 750,000 poultry is close to being   completed. Â The plan was implemented following the discovery of the HPAI H5N1 in   Iksan and at Hwangdeung, in North Cholla province. No additional outbreaks of   H5N1 have been reported.
content_3: A 9-year-old child was rumored on the Internet to be infected with H5N1 pneumonia and was hospitalized in the town of Rimouski in Quebec, Canada.  The rumor started when certain sites posted that "several independent sources reported the child had H5N1," but this was denied by by Dr. Patrick Dolce, the head of microbiology at the hospital in Rimouski.
